# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's the Julia code that implements your requirement:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(text, " ")
    result = ""
    for word in words
        if length(result) + length(word) > text_width
            result *= "\n"
        elseif !isempty(result)
            result *= " "
        end
        result *= word
    end
    return result
end
```

Example usage:

```julia
println(wrap_string("Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua.", 25))
```

This would output:

```shell
Lorem ipsum dolor sit
amet, consectetur
adipiscing elit. Sed
do eiusmod tempor
incididunt ut labore
et dolore magna
aliqua.
```
